etymology.description: 入(入) (rù, 'enter') + 一(一) (yī, 'one') — to gather from multiple sides
etymology.interpretation: The combination of 入(入) (rù, 'enter') and 一(一) (yī, 'one') illustrates the concept of gathering from various directions into a singular point. This represents the act of coming together or assembling.

examples.chinese: 我們(我們)的(的)社群(社群)亼聚(亼聚)一起(一起)。
examples.pinyin: wǒmen de shèqún rén jù yīqǐ。

examples.chinese: 亼會(亼會)是(是)古老(古老)的(的)聚會(聚會)。
examples.pinyin: rén huì shì gǔlǎo de jùhuì。
